title: Sugar-free sodas linked to a higher risk of death in study of 452,000 people
text:
Sugar-free sodas linked to a higher risk of death in study of 452,000 people More

Here’s some less-than refreshing news about soda: even sugar-free versions were associated with a higher risk of death in a study of 452,000 people in 10 countries. The study, published Tuesday by the Journal of the American Medical Association, found that people who drank two or more glasses of soft drinks per day were more likely to die from all types of ailments, compared with people who drank less than one glass per month. “Results of this study appear to support ongoing public-health measures to reduce the consumption of soft drinks,” the researchers concluded.
